meanings.definition: In a cheerful or happy manner.
meanings.sent1: She greeted her friends cheerily at the party.
meanings.sent2: The children sang cheerily during the school assembly.
meanings.sent3: The puppy wagged its tail cheerily as it chased its own shadow.
meanings.sent4: The sun rose cheerily over the horizon, painting the sky with warm colors.
meanings.sent5: The old man whistled cheerily while tending to his garden.

meanings.sent1: Her cheerily painted room always lifted her spirits.
meanings.sent2: The cheerily decorated Christmas tree brightened up the living room.
meanings.sent3: The cheerily dressed clown made everyone laugh with his silly antics.
meanings.sent4: The cheerily colored flowers in the garden danced in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The cheerily smiling baby brought joy to everyone around.

meanings.sent1: The cheerily atmosphere of the party put everyone in a good mood.
meanings.sent2: The cheerily laughter of the children echoed through the park.
meanings.sent3: The cheerily faces of the audience showed their enjoyment of the performance.
meanings.sent4: The cheerily songbirds chirped melodiously in the trees.
meanings.sent5: The cheerily painted house stood out among the other buildings on the street.
